594187_8456423e80cc316ac438efa4e3086bb8_.raw: Elaboration: #shooting# refers to the tragic incident that occurred on Sunday, July 3, 2016, at the High Noon Guns indoor range in Sarasota, Florida, where Clayton Brumby, a regular customer of the range, accidentally shot his 14-year-old son, Stephen Brumby. The incident happened when a shell casing from a Ruger .22-caliber handgun that Clayton was firing landed on his right shoulder, causing him to flinch and accidentally discharge the weapon, which was pointed at Stephen who was standing behind him. The bullet struck Stephen in the collar area, causing a fatal wound. Stephen later died at Sarasota Memorial Hospital.
